content.text: While laying on their belly, babies move forward by pulling themselves with one elbow and pushing the diagonal leg alternately and switching again and again.

Working with both hand and diagonal leg together and creating a movement together at the same time Increases the connection of the nerve system in the brain by creating more and more connections between the left and right hemispheres and increase coordination.
At this stage the level of independence increases the ability to explore more of their surroundings and the level of curiosity to rise.

If you are seeing that your baby has a hard time achieving the specific milestones described in the description or are at the age of 8 months and can’t do those things you should consult with your pediatrician or an Infant development guide in order to learn how to help your baby to achieve these important abilities that are the foundation of their physical, sensory and emotional needs:

ul: Army crawling only with the same one arm and leg and not switching between both sides.
Crawling only moving the hands, without moving the legs at all.
Crawling only moving the legs, without moving the hands at all.
Crawling like a worm, meaning laying on the belly with legs straight on the floor, arms pushing with feet and falling forward on their belly.
Most kids do not crawl the army crawl and are moving directly to a regular crawl because they don’t have the ability to create this movement!
